content.rendered:
The Campus Activities Board (CAB) at the University of La Verne is a non-profit student organization, which serves as the largest student program board on campus coordinating a variety of programs annually. The Campus Activities Board is one of the most exciting and active groups on campus. CAB has nine different chair positions that focus on the following areas (Major Events has 2 individuals):

Areas include:

  • Comedy
  • Concerts
  • Films
  • Spirit
  • Major Events
  • Multicultural
  • Philanthropy
  • Special Events
  • Outreach

CAB constantly strives to develop new and innovative programs for the La Verne community. Through involvement, CAB also provides students with concrete experiences in planning, publicizing, and implementing programs helping them develop lifelong skills to complement their academic experiences at the University of La Verne.
